page.title: 08CLUBS IN PATCHWAY EAST
page.content: There are clubs for various age groups {Adults}use The Hut.It was built in 1918 .It is now used for clubs and other classes. They have keep-fit, playgroup,bingo,Womens Guild,whist, pensioners,ballet,fund raising activities and motorbike club.It is owned by the community. There are two{youth centres}in the area.They use them for out door games and other youth activities. About 400 people a week use the buildings doing archery,football,rounders, discos and dances.The two buidings were built in the 1960s.The{Scout and Guide}movement is very active in this area.Packs meet in their head quarters near the Community Centre and on Little Stoke playing fields, as well as in several schools.All packs go camping, parade and do other activities .They also work for their proficiency badges.
